title: The Fifth Annual Loving The Alien: A Bowie Tribute Dance Party
description: Join DJ Steve Reynolds for a night of Bowie’s biggest hits and deep cuts from his 50-year career.

title: AI from Metropolis to Ex Machina... or How the Movies Have Been Warning Us for Nearly 100 Years
description: Film Forum presents a three-week festival of 30+ movies that helped introduce the world to the concept of ‘artificial intelligence,’ most of which offer a dystopian view.

title: 10th Annual New Ear Festival
description: Fridman Gallery hosts three evenings of musical performances, physical movement, video, and sound installations by Henry Threadgill, Brian Chase, Kyp Malone, Shara Lunon, Marleigh Belsley, and more.

title: House of Yes Nine Year Anniversary
description: Bushwick performance-fueled nightclub House of Yes celebrates its ninth birthday with a weekend of over-the-top extravagant joy-filled performance and dance.

title: Swamp in the City Presents: T’Monde
description: T’Monde, a three-piece band hailing from Lafayette, Louisiana, brings their harmonies and blend of country, creole ballads, and contemporary cajun sounds to Jalopy Theater. The evening starts with a cajun dance lesson.
address: Jalopy Theater, Columbia Street Waterfront District, NYC

title: New Year’s Day Hikes
description: Start the year on the right foot with a hike through one of NYC's public parks, led by urban park rangers. Scenic strolls are offered in each borough.

title: Coney Island Polar Bear Club’s Annual New Year’s Day Plunge
description: Join a wave of winter warriors for Coney Island's largest off-season event. This annual tradition invites New Yorkers to take a communal dip on the first day of the year.
cost: Free to watch or participate ($25+ suggested donation for participants)

title: The Poetry Project’s 51st Annual New Year’s Day Marathon
description: The Poetry Project’s biggest fundraiser of the year returns to St. Mark’s Church in the East Village with over 130 poets, musicians, dancers, writers, and performers. The 10-hour event is divided into 2 segments, 1-6pm and 7pm-midnight, which are ticketed separately.
address: St. Mark’s Church, East Village, NYC
cost: $30 adv, $35 door, $20 for 9pm entry, pay-what-you-can livestream

title: New Year’s Day Sideshow
description: Turn your polar bear plunge chills into thrills at Coney Island USA’s annual New Year’s Day circus sideshow, featuring performers Alaska the Lost Boy, Cyclone Jack Sullivan, Obsidian Absurd, and Niki B.

title: A Sparkling Dry January Kickoff Party
description: Explore the world of non-alcoholic drinks with like-minded folks at this dry January social mixer. All drinks served will be non-alcoholic, and the folks from Third Place Bar and Bar Nun will be hosting icebreakers to help get the conversation started.
address: Hekate Café + Elixir Lounge, Alphabet City/East Village, NYC

title: 718 Sessions New Year’s Day Party
description: Shake off 2024 at Danny Krivit’s annual New Year’s house and disco party.
cost: $5 for the first 100 folks before 7pm, $25-30 otherwise

title: 21st Annual New Year’s Hank-O-Rama
description: ‘Vintage twangabilly’ band The Lonesome Prairie Dogs hosts a musical tribute to country singer Hank Williams on the 72nd anniversary of his death, featuring performances by The Lonesome Horns, Tammy Faye Starlite, Lenny Kaye, and many others.
address: The Bowery Electric, East Village, NYC
